page.title: 10CHRISTIAN WORSHIP
page.content: THERE ARE TWO PLACES OF WORSHIP. ONE IS A WELSH PREBYTERIAN CHAPEL CALLED MAMRE. THIS CAUSE WAS BEGUN IN 1843. THE MEMBERSHIP IS NOW DOWN TO A DOZEN. THE CHAPEL ITSELF ABUTS AN EMPTY CHAPEL HOUSE, BUT IS A ROBUST BUILDING. IT EVEN HAS A SMALL GALLERY.THERE IS NOT A MINISTER AT PRESENT. THE CHURCH IN WALES OR ANGLICAN ESTABLISHMENT IS EQUALLY WEAK, WITH SPARSE CONGREGATIONS. THERE IS NO VICAR AT PRESENT. SUPPORT FOR THE CHURCH IS ALMOST WHOLLY ENGLISH AND INCOMING OR FOREIGN. THE SUNDAY SCHOOL IS HELD IN THE SCHOOL AND HAS A MARKED EVANGELICAL TENDENCY.. SUPPORT IS SMALL AND LESSENING.
